qas.question: How much area of downtown Houston does the Theater District cover?
What place produces live concerts, plays and comedy?
What tourist offerings does the Space Center have?
What is the Galleria the largest of in Texas?
How much area of downtown Texas does the Theater District cover?
What place banned live concerts, plays and comedy?
What tourist offerings does the Space Center not have?
What is the Galleria the largest of in Houston?

context: The Theater District is a <a0_0><b5_0>17-block area<b5_0/><a0_0/> in the center of downtown Houston that is home to the Bayou Place entertainment complex, restaurants, movies, plazas, and parks. Bayou Place is a large multilevel building containing full-service restaurants, bars, live music, billiards, and Sundance Cinema. The <a1_0><b6_0>Bayou Music Center<b6_0/><a1_0/> stages live concerts, stage plays, and stand-up comedy. Space Center Houston is the official visitors' center of NASA's <a2_0><b7_0>Lyndon B. Johnson Space Center<b7_0/><a2_0/>. The Space Center has many <a3_0><b8_0>interactive exhibits<b8_0/><a3_0/> including moon rocks, a shuttle simulator, and presentations about the history of NASA's manned space flight program. Other tourist attractions include the Galleria (Texas's largest <a4_0><b9_0>shopping mall<b9_0/><a4_0/>, located in the Uptown District), Old Market Square, the Downtown Aquarium, and Sam Houston Race Park.
